item.title: Beveridgean Phillips Curve
item.description: This paper builds a Beveridgean model of the Phillips curve. Prices respond to slack so the divine coincidence holds: prices are stable at full employment.

item.title: Business Cycles and How to Tame Them
item.description: This minicourse describes business cycles, develops a matching model to explain them, and discusses how monetary and fiscal policy can tame them.

item.title: An Economical Business-Cycle Model
item.description: This paper develops a policy-oriented business-cycle model with fluctuating unemployment and long zero-lower-bound episodes. Published in OEP, 2022.

item.title: Resolving New Keynesian Anomalies with Wealth in the Utility Function
item.description: This paper resolves the New Keynesian model's anomalies at the zero lower bound by introducing wealth in the utility function. Published in REStat, 2021.
